700343f.text:
West 230th Street (right), at the N.E. corner of Broadway. On the left appears a portion of the elevated structure of the I.R.T. Van Cortlandt
Park subway line.
October 27, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

700344f-a.text:
West 230th Street, adjoining the N. W. corner of Broadway, showing the Macomb Mansion. In 1693 the house was known as "the public house at the north end of the bridge", and in 1776 as Cox's Tavern. Alexander Macomb bought the house in 1779. In the foreground is Spuyten Duyvil Creek. Also shown (right) is the elevated structure of the 1. R. T. Van Cortlandt 'ark subway line,
on Broadway.
1910
Gift of Randall Comfort
(2)
The same site, at a later date. The gasoline station stands
almost at the exact spot of the Macomb Mansion.
October 27, 1927
P. L. Sperr
